fullText: Review — Buena Vista Social Club The Broadway Review: ‘Buena Vista Social Club’ brings ebullient trova music to Broadway but leaves history behind Marco Ramirez’s musical — a transfer from Off-Broadway — skims over pre- and post-Revolution Cuban life, but vividly displays what came of it: incredible music. , and Brittani Samuel March 20, 2025 . 12:41 AM 10 min read Share on Twitter Share on Facebook Share on LinkedIn Share via Email The cast of “Buena Vista Social Club” on Broadway, 2025 (Credit: Matthew Murphy) This post is for paying subscribers only Subscribe now Already have an account? Sign in Review — Buena Vista Social Club — News — Marco Ramirez — Saheem Ali — Julio Monge — Natalie Venetia Belcon — Ashley De La Rosa — Isa Antonetti — Marco Paguia — Justin Peck — Patricia Delgado — Atlantic Theater Company — Arnulfo Maldonado — Dede Ayite — Tyler Micoleau — Jonathan Deans Introductory Offer $1/month for 3 months Subscribe Already have an account? dtliExcerpt: Faults in the sometimes wooden acting from principal cast members (some of whom, to be fair, come from the music world) are eclipsed by the sonic brilliance of it all.

brings ebullient trova music to Broadway but leaves history behind
